summary: The diff introduces new sidebar-related CSS tokens and a `.sidebar-nav-button` class intended to make sidebar buttons opaque, but the provided changes do not clearly demonstrate the full REQ-1 acceptance criteria (consistent default/hover/focus/active states across desktop + mobile sidebar). There are also unrelated changes (URL/session parameter utilities and project state metadata) not requested by the styling-only BuildRequest.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure all sidebar navigation buttons/links render as solid, filled-in buttons with clear borders and consistent default/hover/focus/active states in both light and dark mode, for both desktop sidebar and mobile sidebar sheet.
missing_requirements.reason: While `frontend/src/index.css` adds sidebar color tokens and a `.sidebar-nav-button` rule to remove backdrop filtering, the diff does not show concrete implementation of consistent default/hover/focus/active state styling (including borders) applied to all sidebar items, nor does it provide verifiable evidence that the same styling is applied in the mobile sidebar Sheet as required. `frontend/src/components/AppShell.tsx` is truncated, so the necessary class usage/state styling cannot be confirmed from the diff summary.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/expanded URL parameter utilities including sessionStorage persistence helpers (e.g., store/retrieve/clear session parameters and clearing params from hash).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-1, which is a styling-only sidebar navigation box update; these changes are unrelated to sidebar button appearance.

hallucinated_features.description: Updated `project_state.json` with new_feature_requests entries (AR-1/AR-2) marked pending.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not part of the requested frontend styling implementation; the BuildRequest does not ask for project metadata/state file updates.
